{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks for the TCA intermediate used in haem synthesis. Document [13] states that during late stages of erythropoiesis, cellular metabolism is remodeled so that glutamine is the precursor for ALA following deamination to α-ketoglutarate and conversion to succinyl-CoA by α-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase (KDH) without equilibration or passage through the TCA cycle. This suggests that succinyl-CoA is used in haem synthesis.", "answer_choice": "D"}
